IV.i.2.A.3.a
.
Definition:  DBQs
Disability benefits questionnaires
(DBQs) are documents used to
elicit medical information needed to make decisions on claims, and
provide a standardized report format for medical examinations and opinions.
DBQs are designed for internal use by both VHA and contract examiners.  Most are also approved for public use by private providers.
Reference
:  For more information on DBQs, see the
DBQ Switchboard
.
title: M21-1, Part IV, Subpart i, Chapter 2, Section A - Examination Requests Overview
citation: Part IV, Subpart i, Chapter 2, Section A
